references.content:

tables.table_title: Variables used in the scheduling model.
headers: Indicates the amount of ore to be transported by the transport truck $j$ between the loading point $i$ and the unloading point.
rows: Indicates the $j$ number of transportation tasks performed by the transport truck between the loading $i$ and unloading points.
Indicates the number $j$ of transportation tasks between loading $i$ and unloading points in the transportation task sequence of the first $k$ transportation truck.
The number of meets and waits for truck $k$ on the ramp section under the current transport task sequence.

tables.table_title: Parameters used by the scheduling model.
rows:
Number of transport trucks operating simultaneously during shift working
hours
Carrying capacity of the transport truck
Target ore volume transported during shift working hours

The length of the transportation path from the loading point $i$ to the
unloading point $j$
Grade of ore at loading point $i$
The highest grade of ore required at the discharge point $j$
Minimum grade of ore permitted at the discharge point $j$
Ore quantity at the loading point $i$
Minimum ore quantity required at the discharge point $j$
Waiting time of the empty car when the car meets on the slope section
The interval between each truck when the fleet starts running
Cycle time between loading point $i$ and unloading point $j$
Working hours of transport truck shift

tables.table_title: Transportation distance between each pass and surface ore bin (unit: km).
Ore volume and ore grade of each pass.
Target ore volume and target grade of surface ore bin.
rows: Target ore volume of ore bin (ton)

tables.table_title: Optimal ore blending schemes calculated by the three algorithms.
headers: Ore volume transported by each ore bin (ton)
Ore grade of each ore bin (\%)

tables.table_title: The convergence degree of the three algorithms when they reach the optimal.
headers: Number of iterations when the optimal solution is reached
Ore volume transported by each ore bin (ton)
Ore grade of each ore bin (\%)

tables.table_title: Optimal ore blending scheme (truck transportation times).
The number of meeting times corresponding to the optimal solution of each algorithm.
The convergence degree of the three algorithms when they reach the optimal.
headers:
Number of iterations when the optimal
solution is reached

tables.table_title: The truck transportation task sequence corresponding to the optimal plan.
